content.description: Start on a not-so-great right hand sloper and your left hand on a better left hand sloper. Bump up to a rail with your left hand, adjust your feet, and match on the rail. Your left hand goes out to a good edge. Move your feet, and throw for the lip. Throw a heel up, and rock on up. This is a fun problem. The start is a little burly.
content.location: If you come in from Reservoir Rd., you take a right onto the main path.  Then bushwhack left through the woods.  This boulder is on the side of stream near a huge, overhung boulder with no holds.

content.description: Falling Water is a cool, little, overhanging block kind of perched up on a slab of rock. Unfortunately, there is a bit of glass around this boulder from parties at the WM Boulder.
